Tang Dynasty, 49th year of the sexagenary cycle, Gengxu. Emperor Ruizong changed the era name to Jingyun. The eighth son of Gaozong.
Originally enfeoffed as Prince Yu.
Empress Wu Zetian deposed Emperor Zhongzong and established him as emperor.
After seven years, he was deposed and enfeoffed as Prince Xiang.
He lived to the age of fifty-five.
He established Longji as the crown prince.
He appointed Song Jing and Yao Chong to govern.
The emperor's sister, Princess Taiping, relied on her merits and acted with arrogance.
He reigned for three years.
Renzi. Initially changed to Taiji, then changed to Tihua, then changed to Xiantian. In the seventh month, he passed the throne to the crown prince.
2. The first year of Xiantian.
The 33rd Patriarch, Great Master Huineng, passed away.
His surname was Lu.
His ancestors were from Fanyang.
His father was Xingjian.
During the Wude era, he served as an official in Xinzhou, Nanhai.
Thus he settled there.
At the age of three, he lost his father. His mother kept her will and raised him.
When he grew up, the family was poor.
The master gathered firewood to provide for them.
One day, carrying firewood to the market,
he heard a guest reading the Diamond Sutra.
Startled, he asked the guest,
What is this Dharma?
From whom did you obtain it?
The guest said,
This is called the Diamond Sutra.
I obtained it from the Great Master Ren of Huangmei.
Returning home, he told his mother and, seeking the Dharma and a teacher, went straight to Huangmei.
The Great Master Ren saw him once and silently recognized him.
Later, he transmitted the robe and Dharma to him and ordered him to hide in the areas of Huaiji and Sihui.
On the eighth day of the first month in the first year of Yifeng, he arrived in the South China Sea.
And then returned to Caoxi, pouring down the great Dharma rain.
One day, he said to the assembly,
All good and virtuous friends, listen attentively as I speak the Dharma.
Your own mind is Buddha.
Do not doubt it any further.
There is not a single external thing that can establish it.
All of these are the myriad dharmas born from the fundamental mind.

When the mind ceases, the myriad dharmas cease.

If you do not abide in characteristics in all places,
And do not give rise to aversion or attachment towards dharmas,
Nor grasp or reject anything,

Being at ease, tranquil, empty, and pure,
This is called the samÄdhi of one characteristic.
If you practice, abide, sit, and lie down in complete and utter sincerity in all places,
Without moving from the place of practice, you will accomplish the pure land.

If a person possesses these two samÄdhis,
It is like the earth having seeds that can contain, nurture, and accomplish their substance.
One characteristic and one practice are also like this.
The Dharma I now expound is like timely rain universally moistening the great earth.
Your Buddha-nature is like a seed that, when moistened, will sprout. Those who accept my words will surely attain enlightenment.
Those who follow my practice will definitely realize the wonderful fruit.
The master taught the Dharma and liberated people.
Those who came and went to study were always over a thousand in number.
The following year, in the seventh month, he took leave to return to Guoneng Temple in his hometown of Xinzhou.
His disciples wept and said,
If the master returns, will he come again?
The master said,
When the leaves fall, they return to the roots. When coming, there are no words.

He arrived at Guoneng Temple.

Now, I teach the Dharma for you but do not pass on the robe.

You are able to take on great matters.
Listen to my verse:
The mind-ground contains all seeds.
The universal rain causes them all to sprout.

He further said to the assembly:

You should not contemplate stillness or emptiness in your mind.
This mind is originally pure, with nothing to accept or reject. Each of you should strive with effort and go well with the conditions.
My nirvana time has come, cherish it well.
Then he sat in full lotus posture and passed away.
At that time, the mountains and forests turned white, and birds and beasts cried mournfully.

The Old Tang History says that Empress Wu heard of Shenxiu's name and ordered him to the capital.

At that time, the king, officials, and the common people of the capital city,

They bowed and paid homage from afar, numbering in the tens of thousands.
At first, Shenxiu and Huineng were both disciples of Hongren.

After Hongren passed away, Huineng stayed at Guangfo Temple in Shaozhou.
In the mountains of Shaoyang, there were many tigers and leopards.

Xing finished reading them.
He ordered the eunuch to hold the original text and recite it to the emperor.

The emperor was astonished and said to those around him:
He is a sage.
From then on, he frequently summoned Xing to consult about the essentials of the Buddha's mind.
Xing's dignified explanations and eloquence increased the emperor's favor day by day.
The people of the world.
